countries.name: Japan
countries.fact: Japan is home to more than 6,800 islands, but about 97% of its land area is covered by the four largest ones: Honshu, Hokkaido, Kyushu, and Shikoku.

countries.name: Australia
countries.fact: Australia is wider than the moon. The diameter of Australia is about 4,000 km, while the moon's diameter is 3,474 km.

countries.name: Brazil
countries.fact: Brazil is the only country in South America where Portuguese is the official language, due to its colonization by Portugal.

countries.name: India
countries.fact: India has the largest postal network in the world, with over 150,000 post offices across the country.

countries.name: Canada
countries.fact: Canada has the longest coastline of any country in the world, spanning over 202,080 km.

countries.name: Iceland
countries.fact: Iceland does not have a standing army. It is one of the few countries in the world without any military forces.

countries.name: Russia
countries.fact: Russia is so large that it spans 11 time zones, covering more territory than any other country.

countries.name: Egypt
countries.fact: The Great Pyramid of Giza was the tallest man-made structure in the world for over 3,800 years, standing at 146.6 meters.

countries.name: Norway
countries.fact: Norway is home to the Svalbard Global Seed Vault, which preserves seeds from around the world to ensure biodiversity in case of global crises.

countries.name: Mexico
countries.fact: Mexico introduced chocolate, chillies, and corn to the world. The ancient civilizations of Mexico, like the Mayans, were the first to make chocolate.
